title: Verify if BQR is enforced when  BQR defined only for default buyer type of the non primary event_Resrvation
custom_steps:
1. 1.Create a package with a inventoried event and a non inventoried event in it.
2.Create a bundle value promotion and associate the package to it
3.In Supplier administration - buyer type configuration tab -Create two buyer types BUYER1 and BUYER2; BUYER1 should be associated to the bundle value promotion and BUYER2 should be a normal buyer type.
4.Both the buyer type should exihibit 'Exactly one' relationship (1 BUYER2 requires exactly 1 BUYER1 )i.e. BUYER2 is the dependent buyer type.
Expected Result:
User should be able  to complete the pre-requisite successfully.
2. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login to the PV Application
3. 1.In Ticket sales, select the inventoried event and select the bundle value promotion from promotion dropdown
2.Select 1 BUYER2(dependent buyer type) from selection guide
3. Click on LOCK SEATS
Expected Result:
User should be able to select the promotion and buyer types
4. Verify if the dependent buyer type can be purchased when promotion is associated only to the required buyer type_Exactly one relationship exists between the two buyer types
Expected Result:
1.User should be able to complete the transaction with the dependent buyer type (bundle value buyer type) when the required buyer type is also choosed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Create a package with a inventoried event and a non inventoried event in it.

4.Both the buyer type should exihibit 'Exactly one' relationship (1 BUYER2 requires exactly 1 BUYER1 )i.e. BUYER2 is the dependent buyer type.

2.Select 1 BUYER2(dependent buyer type) from selection guide

2. The user should be able to login to the PV Application
3. User should be able to select the promotion and buyer types
4. 1.User should be able to complete the transaction with the dependent buyer type (bundle value buyer type) when the required buyer type is also choosed.

title: Verify Dependent Set Additive rulefor where the dependent quantities are different and the dependent operators are all EXACTLY.
custom_steps:
1. Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be logged in successfully
2. 1.Navigate to Ticketing Setup > Supplier Administration > Buyer Type Configuration page
Expected Result:
Buyer Type Configuration page should be displayed.
3. 1.Select a buyer type and click on Edit button to define a relationship
2.Define a relation where the dependent quantities are different and the dependent operators are all EXACTLY

Rule: Dependent Set Additive

X:Y Ratio       Exactly         3       Child   requires        Upto    2       Adult   Not Capped      

X:Y Ratio       Exactly         2       Child   requires        Upto    2       Senior  Not Capped
Expected Result:
Sytem should allow to define relationship
4. Navigate to Ticket Sales portal.
Expected Result:
Ticket Sales portal should be displayed.
5. Search and select the event/package for which the dependent and required buyer types are available.
Expected Result:
Event should be displayed.
6. 1.Verify that indicator icon is displayed against dependent buyer type.
2.Verify that the quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
Expected Result:
Indicator icon should be displayed against dependent buyer type.
The quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
7. Lock seats for very large requested quantities such that the sum of calculated required multiplication factors is > 100


C3V     P5A     P6A     P7A     Expected        

252     150     100     6       Locked with msg in PV Log  

30      450     400     10      Locked with msg in PV Log

1. Define Relationship as Define Relationship as X to Y Ratio Up To 3 CHILD REQUIRES Exactly 2 ADULT Capped
2. Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be logged in successfully
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales portal.
Expected Result:
Ticket Sales portal should be displayed.
4. Search and select the event/package for which the dependent and required buyer types are available.
Expected Result:
Event should be displayed.
5. 1.Verify that indicator icon is displayed against dependent buyer type.
2.Verify that the quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
Expected Result:
Indicator icon should be displayed against dependent buyer type.
The quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
6. Lock the seats in such a way that it satisfies the Rule set. (For example, up to 3 (i.e. 1-3) CHILD tickets are allowed when 2 ADULT tickets are selected.)
Verify the Buyer Type Quantity relationship_up to X number of dependent buyer type tickets requires that exactly Y number of required buyer type tickets are also selected
Expected Result:
User should be able to lock seats and naviagate to shopping cart.
7. Verify that the user is able to complete the transaction.
Expected Result:
User should be able to complete the transaction

title: Verify the NON CAPPED required buyer type allows a quantity greater than the requirement for the relationship when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
custom_steps:
1. 1.Create two buyer types Child and Adult
2.Navigate to Child buyer type configuration page
3.Define Relationship as EXACTLY 1 CHILD Requires EXACTLY 1 ADULT NOT CAPPED with validation rule ALL
4.Create an event/package such that the dependent and required buyer types are available for sale.
2. Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be logged in successfully
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales portal.
Expected Result:
Ticket Sales portal should be displayed.
4. Search and select the event/package for which the dependent and required buyer types are available.
Expected Result:
Event should be displayed.
5. 1.Verify that indicator icon is displayed against dependent buyer type.
2.Verify that the quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
Expected Result:
Indicator icon should be displayed against dependent buyer type.
The quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
6. Lock more number of seats for required buyer type than needed for dependent buyer type selected 
(1 CHILD seat, 3 ADULT seats OR 5 CHILD seat, 12 ADULT seats)
Verify the NON CAPPED required buyer type allows a quantity greater than the requirement for the relationship when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
Expected Result:
User should be able to lock seats and naviagate to shopping cart.
(When the required buyer type quantity is set to a non-capped value, the number of tickets purchased at the required buyer type shall allow a quantity greater than the requirement for the relationship, essentially unlimited.   )
7. Verify that the user is able to complete the transaction.
Expected Result:
User should be able to complete the transaction

7. Verify that the user is able to complete the transaction.

1.

title: Verify if the dependent buyer type can be purchased when promotion is associated only to the required buyer type_Exactly one relationship exists between the two buyer types_bundle promotion
custom_steps:
1. 1.Create a package with a inventoried event and a non inventoried event in it.
2.Create a bundle value promotion and associate the package to it
3.In Supplier administration - buyer type configuration tab -Create two buyer types BUYER1 and BUYER2; BUYER1 should be associated to the bundle value promotion and BUYER2 should be a normal buyer type.
4.Both the buyer type should exihibit 'Exactly one' relationship (1 BUYER2 requires exactly 1 BUYER1 )i.e. BUYER2 is the dependent buyer type.
Expected Result:
User should be able  to complete the pre-requisite successfully.
2. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login to the PV Application
3. 1.In Ticket sales, select the inventoried event and select the bundle value promotion from promotion dropdown
2.Select 1 BUYER2(dependent buyer type) from selection guide
3. Click on LOCK SEATS
Expected Result:
User should be able to select the promotion and buyer types
4. Verify if the dependent buyer type can be purchased when promotion is associated only to the required buyer type_Exactly one relationship exists between the two buyer types
Expected Result:
1.User should be able to complete the transaction with the dependent buyer type (bundle value buyer type) when the required buyer type is also choosed.

title: Verify if transaction can be completed when the buyer type relationship breaks the min,max rule value set at the promotion
custom_steps:
1. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login to the PV Application
2. 1.In Supplier administration - buyer type configuration tab - Create two buyer types BUYER1 and BUYER2; BUYER1 is system selectable and BUYER2 is user selectable 

2.The buyer type relationship should be in such a way that "Exactly 1 BUYER1 requires 4 BUYER2";
Expected Result:
User should be able to create the buyer types and buyer type relationship
3. Create a Promotion; PROM1 should be associated to BUYER1
Expected Result:
The user should be able to create a promotion
4. In the promotion Administration, for the mentioned promotion set the min limit as 1 and max limit as 3.
Expected Result:
User should be able to set the min/max limit
5. In ticket sales, select the promotion and choose three BUYER1,and 4 BUYER2(required) and click on LOCK SEATs
Expected Result:
Error should not be displayed, when one BUYER1 and 4 BUYER2(required) are selected and click on LOCK SEATs
6. In ticket sales, select the promotion and choose FOUR BUYER1,and 16 BUYER2(required) and click on LOCK SEATs
Expected Result:
Error should be displayed (that the matching seat request breaks the min/max rule), when FOUR BUYER1 and 16 BUYER2(required) are selected and clicked on LOCK SEATs.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
2. 1.In Supplier administration - buyer type configuration tab - Create two buyer types BUYER1 and BUYER2; BUYER1 is system selectable and BUYER2 is user selectable 

2.The buyer type relationship should be in such a way that "Exactly 1 BUYER1 requires 4 BUYER2";
3. Create a Promotion; PROM1 should be associated to BUYER1
4. In the promotion Administration, for the mentioned promotion set the min limit as 1 and max limit as 3.
5. In ticket sales, select the promotion and choose three BUYER1,and 4 BUYER2(required) and click on LOCK SEATs
6. In ticket sales, select the promotion and choose FOUR BUYER1,and 16 BUYER2(required) and click on LOCK SEATs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The user should be able to login to the PV Application
2. User should be able to create the buyer types and buyer type relationship
3. The user should be able to create a promotion
4. User should be able to set the min/max limit
5. Error should not be displayed, when one BUYER1 and 4 BUYER2(required) are selected and click on LOCK SEATs
6. Error should be displayed (that the matching seat request breaks the min/max rule), when FOUR BUYER1 and 16 BUYER2(required) are selected and clicked on LOCK SEATs.

title: verify if dependent buyer type can be purchased, when 2 different promotions are associated to 2 different buyer types
custom_steps:
1. 1.Launch the PV link >

Expected Result:

3. Create a discount value Promotion and  associate it to BUYER1
Expected Result:

4. Create a coupon code and associate it to the promotion
Expected Result:

2.Select 1 BUYER2(required buyer) from selection guide and LOCK SEATS and navigate to the cart
Expected Result:
Validation error message should be displayed that BUYER1(dependent buyer type) also is needed.
6. 4.Select the BUYER1(dependent buyer) from selection guide
Expected Result:
user should be able to complete the locking of seats.
7. Verify if dependent buyer type can be purchased alone,via add offer when required buyer type is already in the cart
Expected Result:
1.When the dependent buyer type is choosed alone (required buyer type is already availble in the cart) and LOCK SEATS is clicked,validation should fail during seat lock, do not complete the transaction.
2. The expected error message shoulde be displayed
8. 5.verify if required buyer type can be purchased, when a coupon code associated promotion is associated to both buyer types and both the buyer types exhibits 'Exactly one' reciprocal relationship

2.The required buyer type(BUYER2) should be purchased along with the dependent buyer type(BUYER1)

title: Verify the CAPPED required buyer type is restricted to the specified quantity (or quantity increments) when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
custom_steps:
1. 1. Input Valid Supplier Code in the Supplier Search Text box
2. Click FIND button.
Expected Result:
System should display Supplier list configured  in the Search Result Grid
2. 1. Click Configuration Tab in the Supplier Administration Portlet
2. Select Buyer Type form the drop down
3. Search Buyer Type
4. Click Buyer type Code Link
Expected Result:
The Buyer Type details should be displyed
3. Define Relationships
Verify the CAPPED required buyer type is restricted to the specified quantity (or quantity increments) when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
Expected Result:
When a capped qualifier is used, the required buyer type is restricted to the specified quantity (or quantity increments) when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
For example, the Exact Same Quantity ratio type shall automatically default to a capped value since the number of required buyer type tickets shall be limited to the same quantity as the dependent buyer type tickets.
4. Call

3. Search Buyer Type
4. Click Buyer type Code Link
3. Define Relationships
Verify the CAPPED required buyer type is restricted to the specified quantity (or quantity increments) when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
4. Call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. System should display Supplier list configured  in the Search Result Grid
2. The Buyer Type details should be displyed
3. When a capped qualifier is used, the required buyer type is restricted to the specified quantity (or quantity increments) when selected in an offer with its dependent buyer type tickets.
For example, the Exact Same Quantity ratio type shall automatically default to a capped value since the number of required buyer type tickets shall be limited to the same quantity as the dependent buyer type tickets.
4.

title: verify if required buyer type can be purchased, when a coupon code associated promotion is associated to both buyer types
custom_steps:
1. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login to the PV Application
2. 1.In Supplier administration - buyer type configuration tab -Create two buyer types BUYER1 and BUYER2, both buyer types are System selectable
2.Both the buyer type should exihibit 'Exactly one' relationship and should be reciprocally associated (BUYER1 requires exactly 1 BUYER2 and BUYER2 requires exactly 1 BUYER1 )
Expected Result:
User should be able to create the buyer types and buyer type relationship
3. Create a discount value Promotion and  associate it to BUYER1
Expected Result:
The user should be able to create a promotion
4. 1.In Ticket sales, select the event and select the promotion from promotion dropdown

2.Select 1 BUYER2(required buyer) from selection guide and LOCK SEATS and navigate to the cart
Expected Result:
Validation error message should be displayed that BUYER1(dependent buyer type) also is needed.
5. Verify if dependent buyer type can be purchased alone,via add offer when required buyer type is already in the cart
Expected Result:
1.When the dependent buyer type is choosed alone (required buyer type is already availble in the cart) and LOCK SEATS is clicked,validation should fail during seat lock, do not complete the transaction.
2. The expected error message shoulde be displayed
6. Create a coupon code and associate it to the promotion
Expected Result:
The coupon code should be associated to the promotion
7. 5.verify if required buyer type can be purchased, when a coupon code associated promotion is associated to both buyer types and both the buyer types exhibits 'Exactly one' reciprocal relationship
Expected Result:
1.Both the buyer types should be hiden when the promotion is not entered.

2.The required buyer type(BUYER2) should be purchased along with the dependent buyer type(BUYER1)
8. 4.Select the BUYER1(dependent buyer) from selection guide
Expected Result:
user should be able to complete the locking of seats.

7. Verify the error message displayed in UI
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1.

3. Ticket Sales portal should be displayed.

The quantity relationship description displayed while hovering over indicator icon.
6. User should NOT be able to lock seats
7. User entered quantity relationship error message should display when validation fails in Ticket Sales when this buyer type is used in an attempted seat lock without any of its required buyer type relationships.

title: Verify buyer type is no longer dependent, if all relationships are removed from a dependent buyer type
custom_steps:
1. 1. Create two buyer types : BUYER1 and BUYER2.
2. Create a buyer type affinity relationship such that one BUYER1 requires exactly one BUYER2 (BUYER2 is the required)
2. Select Ticket Sales option from the drop down
Expected Result:
The Ticket Sales option should be displayed
3. Input the Event code in the event search page and click on Find button
Expected Result:
The user should be navigated to Ticket Sales page of selected event
4. 1.Click on Selection Guide tab in the Ticket Sales page
2.Select the seats
3. Select a delivery method and Complete the Payment
Expected Result:
The system should be complete the Ticket sale Transaction
5. 1. Input Valid Supplier Code in the Supplier Search Text box
2. Click FIND button
Expected Result:
System should display Supplier list configured  in the Search Result Grid
6. 1. Click Configuration Tab in the Supplier Administration Portlet
2. Select Buyer Type form the drop down
3. Search Buyer Type
4. Click Buyer type Code Link
Expected Result:
The Buyer Type details should be displyed should be updated with  Full Price
7. 1. Click on the EDIT button avilable on the  Relationship Block
2. Remove all  the affinity relationship 
3.  Click on Apply changes
Expected Result:
The Updated affinity relationship should be saved successfully
8. repeat the Steps 2-7(Select the BUYER1 alone)
Expected Result:
The transactions should be completed successfully
9. Call

title: Verify if error message is displayed when a hard limit is set for the required buyer type and the tickets locked breaks the hard limit_event level
custom_steps:
1. 1.Create two BUYER types ; create the relationship in such a way that  one BUYER1  requires two BUYER2
2.In Event administration,select the event. 
3.Then  in the capacity control tab of the event, set hard limit  as 5.
4.Associate the  particular Buyer type(BUYER2) for the capacity control.
Expected Result:
The user should be able to complete the pre-requisite successfully.
2. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login to the PV Application
3. 1.In ticket sales, select the 2 dependent buyer type(2 BUYER1), that means 4 required buyer type(4 BUYER2) are required, now click on LOCK SEATS and complete the transaction.
Expected Result:
The user should be able to complete the transaction1
4. Verify if error message is displayed when a hard limit is set for the required buyer type and the tickets locked breaks the hard limit
Expected Result:
1. Error should be displayed that the buyer type affinity relationship breaks the hard limit rule
2. User should not be able to complete the transaction.
5. 1.In ticket sales, select the 1 dependent buyer type(1 BUYER1), that means 2 required buyer type(2 BUYER2) are required, now click on LOCK SEATS
Expected Result:
User should be able to lock the seats
for transaction2

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Create two BUYER types ; create the relationship in such a way that  one BUYER1  requires two BUYER2
2.In Event administration,select the event. 
3.Then  in the capacity control tab of the event, set hard limit  as 5.
4.Associate the  particular Buyer type(BUYER2) for the capacity control.
2. 1.Launch the PV link >
2.Login to the PV application using valid credentials
3. 1.In ticket sales, select the 2 dependent buyer type(2 BUYER1), that means 4 required buyer type(4 BUYER2) are required, now click on LOCK SEATS and complete the transaction.
4. Verify if error message is displayed when a hard limit is set for the required buyer type and the tickets locked breaks the hard limit
5. 1.In ticket sales, select the 1 dependent buyer type(1 BUYER1), that means 2 required buyer type(2 BUYER2) are required, now click on LOCK SEATS
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The user should be able to complete the pre-requisite successfully.
2. The user should be able to login to the PV Application
3. The user should be able to complete the transaction1
4. 1. Error should be displayed that the buyer type affinity relationship breaks the hard limit rule
2. User should not be able to complete the transaction.
5. User should be able to lock the seats
for transaction2
